articles.title: As Iran mulls retaliation for nuclear scientist's death, a riddle remains. What exactly was he working on?
articles.description: Iran's leaders are furious over the killing of a top nuclear scientist, and the Supreme Leader has demanded that Mohsen Fakhrizadeh's work be continued. The broader issue for Iran's adversaries is exactly what that work was.

articles.author: Jordan Valinsky, CNN Business
articles.title: Kodak's stock soars 70% after probe reportedly finds no wrongdoing in government loan
articles.description: Kodak's stock rocketed about 70% higher in premarket trading Monday after the US government reportedly found no wrongdoing in Kodak's now-halted $765 million loan to help the company produce pharmaceutical ingredients.

articles.author: Story by Reuters
articles.title: In Kenya, Covid-19's rural spread strains creaky health care
articles.description: The coronavirus is spreading into rural areas in Kenya where the public health system is creaking and scarce ICU units are full and turning patients away, medics round the nation told Reuters.
articles.content:
Mombasa, KenyaThe recent deaths from Covid-19 in Kenya of a refugee, a member of parliament and a retired civil servant all happened for the same reason: emergency help was hours away.

articles.title: Pope Francis to visit Iraq in March, Vatican says
articles.description: Pope Francis will travel to Iraq in March 2021, the Vatican press office announced on Monday.

articles.title: Trump's Wall Street watchdogs leave a warning for the Biden team
articles.description: As they head out the door, Trump-led financial regulators are warning the incoming Biden team that a little-known yet critical corner of Wall Street is broken.

articles.title: This is what the UK's Covid-19 vaccination cards will look like
articles.description: Images have been released of a credit card-sized document that will be given to recipients of the Covid-19 vaccine in the UK, recording the specifics of the medication and reminding them to receive a second dose of the jab.

articles.title: Ashton Kutcher urges EU to allow tech giants to keep tracking online child abuse
articles.description: American actor and activist Ashton Kutcher is urging EU policymakers to grant tech giants like Facebook and Google a reprieve from new privacy rules that would prohibit them from using automatic detection tools to combat child pornography.

articles.author: Ariane de Vogue, CNN Supreme Court Reporter
articles.title: Holocaust victims suing Germany and Hungary have their day at the Supreme Court on Monday
articles.description: The Supreme Court on Monday will delve into atrocities committed during World War II and hear two cases brought by victims and their family members who are seeking compensation for property they say was stolen from them during the Holocaust.
